abstract.p: Marco Etcheverry, Bolivian midfielder for DC United, is named Major League Soccer's most valuable player (S)

block.p: Marco Etcheverry, the Bolivian midfielder for D.C. United who has led his team to the championship game of Major League Soccer every season in the league's three years of existence, was named the league's most valuable player yesterday in Los Angeles. Etcheverry was voted the award even though he finished eighth in the league in scoring with 39 points from 10 goals and 19 assists.
The league's 1998 champion will be determined tomorrow at the Rose Bowl, with D.C. United facing the Chicago Fire.

The league announced yesterday that next year's championship would be played at Foxboro Stadium near Boston. Foxboro Stadium was the host of the league's first title game in 1996, when a crowd of 34,643 braved a downpour and fierce winds to watch D.C. United's 3-2 overtime triumph over the Los Angeles Galaxy.
The league also announced that Philip F. Anschutz had bought the Los Angeles Galaxy for $26 million. Anschutz, a Denver-based billionaire, also owns the league's Chicago Fire and Colorado Rapids.
